alert.note: Alert for McKinley; Rio Arriba; San Juan (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued May 01 at 2:15PM MDT until May 01 at 3:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Dust Advisory for... North central McKinley County in west central New Mexico... Northwestern Rio Arriba County in north central New Mexico... San Juan County in northwestern New Mexico... * Until 315 PM MDT. * At 214 PM MDT, an area of dust was 10 miles southeast of NAPI Headquarters, or 12 miles south of Bloomfield, moving northeast. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 55 mph. SOURCE...Satellite imagery. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Highway 550 between Mile Markers 114 and 174. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 40 and 102. Locations impacted include... Farmington, Kirtland, Bloomfield, Aztec, Navajo Dam, Nageezi, Upper Fruitland, Cedar Hill, El Huerfano Trading Post and Standing Rock. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. Pull your vehicle fully off the side of the road, keep your headlights off, and take your foot off of the brake pedal. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
